Speaker: nix
Dialogue: And the fire said to me:  Nix, Nix, you're my instrument. From now on, you'll be called the Puritan...

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: We'll come back to this. Get about your business.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You don't like him, do you?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: pimm
Dialogue: Look, maybe we should think this over.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: He's not going to get the chance.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: If he gets in our fucking heads he'll drive us crazy.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Look around.  If you find 'the child, yell.  She's got blonde hair, that's all I know.

Speaker: pimm
Dialogue: He's going to kill us all...

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: Stay the fuck away!  Pimm!  Get over here!

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I've got so much power to give you, Swann.  All you have to do is...beg.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You don't think I've got it to give?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I could eat your fucking soul, Swann.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You want to know what the world really looks like?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Want to see flesh with a god's eyes?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Take a look, Swann!  These are your friends.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Don't touch me.  He's got... got into my head.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You want to be like that, Swann? Mud and shit?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: We bury him so deep no one will ever find him.

Speaker: bellboy
Dialogue: You haven't paid the cab.  He won't give us your bags 'til you pay him.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Tell him he can keep them. The Bellboy looks puzzled.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I've got my life in there.

Speaker: bellboy
Dialogue: Have a nice evening, Mr. D'Amour.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nine-eighteen p.m.  Tapert's either got a great sense of humour or he's paying her to laugh.  Jesus.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nine twenty-six p.m.  He's off again.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: What are you going to do about it?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Ever watched a man die?  If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. And if you're very quick, you can catch it.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: Please... Butterfield... I wasn't there.  Ask Pimm.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared.  They knew the Puritan was coming home.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: So do you.  You've seen the future. Haven't you?

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: Too late.  Why are you here? Did you cone... up here for a reading?

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: You've taken some strange journeys in your life.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: You're drawn to the dark side, over and over.  And it's drawn to you.  You don't like that.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: You can't change it.  You have to walk...  ...walk the line between Heaven and Hell.  It's your destiny.  Accept it.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home...

Speaker: eddison
Dialogue: What were you doing up there?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I'm a private detective.  I was hired to follow somebody for a few days.  A guy called Tapert. Insurance fraud.

Speaker: eddison
Dialogue: Tapert.  So, now I've got Tapert, Butterfield.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Tapert's got nothing to do with this.  He came here to get his palm read.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I got a file on him two inches thick.  He's a petty fraudster. This is something else.  Ever heard of someone called the Puritan?

Speaker: eddison
Dialogue: New one on me.  Okay.  Let's see him.

Speaker: eddison
Dialogue: After that fall?. He must have broken half his bones.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I don't think he'd have given a shit.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: D'Amour... D'Amour... Why do I know that name?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I know him.  I saw him.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I saw him on T.V.  Some kid got possessed and he saved the little bastard's life.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No.  He's just a guy who's got a nose for this shit.  Like you.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: We've all of us waited too long to have the homecoming spoiled.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What do you mean, "all of us?"

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: You didn't think it was just going to be you and me?  A lot of people believed in Nix. They haven't forgotten his promise.

Speaker: radio
Dialogue: "I really want to see you, Lord, And it won't take long, my Lord, My sweet Lord..."

Speaker: clemenzia
Dialogue: In his study.  He got something on his mind?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: The usual.  Full house. Standing ovation.  I tell them it's magic...

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: I'm putting in a new illusion tonight.  Will you be there?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Sure.  You want me to find out about Quaid?  I mean, the funeral?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: No.  I'm not going near him.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Higher.  Another inch.  The left hand side's too low.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I want you to find this man D'Amour for me.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Whatever I said, I didn't mean it, okay?  I get a few drinks inside me --

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I'm here to offer you a job.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I'm going back to New York in--  Shit!  I'm outta here.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Have you got a job that'll pay you five thousand a day?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nah.  You're driving it too carefully.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Somebody's been smoking in here for months.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Havanas.  You're not the smoker.  So who is?

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I work for the best illusionist in the world.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I saw him in Vegas once.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: When I can afford to lose. Swann's quite a magician.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Never call him that.  He's strictly an illusionist.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Illusions are trickery. Magicians do it for real.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: It's not a bad place.  Warm. Great view.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I don't think the dead much care.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I've signed on for them all in my time.  Hindu.  Catholic. You can't have too many saviours.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I want you to help me help my husband.  I know he's in some kind of trouble.  And it's something to do with the man you saw murdered.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Yes.  They weren't close, but they saw each other once in a while.  I think Philip believes all that stuff with the tarot cards.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I think we make our own futures.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I don't exactly know. Philip doesn't like to talk about the past.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: We don't share our lives the way a lot of people do.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: We haven't slept in the same bed for years.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: But obviously you still care what happens to him.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: We wouldn't be having this conversation if I didn't. Swann's one of the most remarkable men alive.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He's an illusionist.  It's not exactly brain surgery.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: No.  You're right.  He could have been something more. Maybe a lot more.  But people get lost.  Even good people. Too much fame.  Too much money,

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Will you take the job, Mr. D'Amour?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: That's not what I'm asking for. I want somebody who can find out what Philip saw in those damn cards. And stop it from happening.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: When do you want me to start?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Come to the show with me. Tonight I want you to see him with an audience.  They love him.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I didn't marry him for love, Mr. D'Amour.  Tonight?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You're not listening to me, Loomis.

Speaker: loomis
Dialogue: The case is closed. Harry. Tapert's given us a full confession.  Get your ass back to Mew York.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: No.  I'm taking a couple of weeks' vacation.

Speaker: loomis
Dialogue: You never took a fucking vacation in your life, Harry. What's going on?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I got to go.  I'm late.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: There's other guys as good as me, Loomis.

Speaker: loomis
Dialogue: Yeah.  But not as cheap.  Call me.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I'm glad you could make it.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Hey, this is a big deal for me. You know what seats like this cost in New York?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: The guy with Dorothea.  Is that who I think it is?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: My friends ... come with me...into the Great Beyond.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I've got to get to him!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Out of the way!  Out of the way!

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Get then out of here, for God's sake --

Speaker: stage manager
Dialogue: You heard him!  It's not a fucking show!

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Who did this, D'Amour?  Who killed Swann?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: You don't have a clue what you're into, do you?

Speaker: eddison
Dialogue: For now.  Are you planning to go back to New York?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I heard what happened.  It looks like somebody murdered him.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I'm sorry I got into this too late. But if you want me to stick around, maybe dig where the cops don't look...

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I don't know where you'd start.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Well... how about some of the other illusionists?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: We'd need to talk about your fee.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Forget the fee.  If I find Butterfield, maybe we'll talk about money.  If I don't...  ...my gamble.  Either way... I get to spend some time... here.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: At birth.  I don't know you --

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: I know all the kids coming up. Got to stay ahead of the game. But I don't know you.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I'm in from New York.  I came to see Swann.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: What a tragedy.  It was just a matter of time, of course, but it's not good for the business.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Was he taking a lot of risks?

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: You don't know the half of it. I'm Walter Wilder, by the way.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: He knew Swann way back.  He says there were a lot of drugs, a lot of crazy shit.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I'd love to... you know... hang with some of you guys.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: People are pretty cagey.  Who do you know?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I only wear ties for funerals.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: You don't get in without one. It's like a gentlemen's club for illusionists.  Except most of us aren't gentlemen.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Are they all in the business?

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: It's not a business. Harry. It's a vocation.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: That's what they call the Repository.  Every magic secret known to man's locked up in that room.

Speaker: wilder
Dialogue: No.  There's only three keys. Vinovich has got one, of course.  He's a little crazy, by the way. And he's a mean drunk. Otherwise, he's a real charmer.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: It's more than entertainment. We're opening people's heads up.  Putting miracles back into their boring little lives.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: Houdini believed he had spirit guides.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: I think we walk a narrow path, between... between...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Are you saying that sometimes the miracles are real?

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: No.  I'm saying they were always fake.  The saints, the messiahs, they were just illusionists.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: So could you walk on water?

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: I could reproduce any miracle that's ever been performed, with a little preparation.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I heard he was the best.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: If he was so good why's he so dead?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You tell me.  No?  I thought you'd maybe have a theory.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: I'm not saying another word.  You damn fool.  He's a journalist.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Just tell me about Swann.  Or are you too scared?

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: He was a freak.  Everything he did was tainted.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: Evil.  He was evil.  Come on.

Speaker: vinovich
Dialogue: Say nothing to this man if you wish to keep my company.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Great accent, by the way.  Is it Brooklyn?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I gotta be careful.  If Vinovich sees me talking to you.  He's an asshole, but he's a powerful asshole.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I've heard a name.  Someone they talk about in whispers.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I think maybe he taught Swann.  This is me.  See ya around.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: Please... I wasn't there... Ask Pimm.

Speaker: quaid
Dialogue: I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I went up to the Magic Castle. You were right.  He didn't have a lot of fans up there.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: He... didn't have me..  I told you-

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You didn't marry him for love.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: So why did you marry him?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Yes... I'm here.  And no.  I don't know the name.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: It doesn't ring a bell.  I have to go.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Looking for you.  I tried the hotel.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: You're a detective, with no clues. Where else are you going to look? I'm going to keep this brief.  Here's thirty thousand dollars.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You didn't hire me.  She did. If she wants me off the job, I want to hear it from her.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: She doesn't want to see you. She's had enough pain.  Enough churning over the past.  She wants it all left alone.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Fuck regrettable!  I want to know why.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: What for?  You need to stay busy?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I like to know why things happen.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Why people die?  Give it up, D'Amour.  Go home.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Don't try and see her, D'Amour. Just leave her alone.  Let her heal.

Speaker: toffler
Dialogue: Jennifer's only ever had one visitor.

Speaker: toffler
Dialogue: Right.  And he's dead, isn't he?  I saw it on the news. Jennifer doesn't know.  And frankly, this isn't the best tine for her to be told.

Speaker: toffler
Dialogue: Jennifer's been with us four years. She was coming on nicely. But just the last month or so, she's worse than ever.

Speaker: toffler
Dialogue: She has no real grip on reality.

Speaker: toffler
Dialogue: Oh yes.  We have to agree what's real and what's not. That's what holds us together.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And what does Jennifer think's real?

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: Only I forget.  They give me pills, you know, to keep me... even... and... I forget things,

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Well, you didn't forget me.  I just came because I wanted to know if you knew a man called Butterfield.

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: I knew Swann.  He's a fucking liar.

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: He said he knew how to protect us. But he didn't know anything.  He made us think it was over and done with.

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: I don't want to think about it. If I think about it he'll hear me. He'll find me.

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: He's not going to get me!

Speaker: jennifer
Dialogue: No.  He's coming back.  He's digging his way out!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I'll take care of her now.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Let go of her, Mr. D'Amour!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I want to speak to Dorothea.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Crank call.  I'll get the number changed.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: It's better he's gone.  He would have done more harm than good.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Harm to whom?  Me?  I don't think, so.  Try him again at the hotel.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Billy?  It's Harry.  Suppose I wanted to get into the repository at the Magic Castle?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I'm sure they'll have this place rigged.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I hear Mrs. Swann's quite a babe.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Yeah.  She was killed in a car crash.  Her lawyer was driving. She was filing for divorce.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: My life was too weird for her.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Billy?  This was on Miller's forehead.  Any idea what it is?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What did I tell you?  So fucking hokey.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I could have lost my fucking hands.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: That would have kept you out of the Magic Circle.  These are about Nix.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You go through these.  Go on!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: At a guess?  The Puritan.  Nix.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I don't know any of these tricks...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What do you mean, they're not tricks?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What did Vinovich say? Something about walking a path between --

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Trickery and divinity.  Yeah, he says that all the time.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: That's because he knew.  He'd seen these files and knew.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I'm out of here, man!  Are you coming?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Hey, anytime.  Actually, no.  This was enough.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: You want more money, is that it?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: This is the way he wanted it... no autopsy, no embalming. Nobody meddling with his body...

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Flesh is a trap.  That's what he used to say.  Flesh is a trap and magic sets us free.  Why did you come back?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I didn't leave.  I was just digging around.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Jennifer Desiderio, for one.  She threw herself in front of a car this afternoon.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Why don't you tell me the truth?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nix ran some kind of cult, right? Some kind of Charlie Manson deal?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: It was more than that, I think.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He was the real thing, right?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Swann said he could do stuff, yes.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: He could get into people's heads. Make them see things. Terrible things.  And he could levitate. Juggle fire.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He taught all this to Swann?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: So Swann was performing magic. not illusions?  And what?  You thought he should be using it to cure cancer, not making millions.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Too much fame.  Yeah, I guess that'd turn anybody's head. Including yours.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You said you weren't with him for love.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I was grateful to him.  I owed him my life.  And he loved me. He couldn't always show it, but he felt it.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He thought Nix was coming back, didn't he?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: No it isn't.  You can't help me.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nothing's going to happen to you.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Don't be.  Nix can't hurt you now.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I know.  I'm the one who shot him.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I was twelve.  Nix took me hostage, to get Swann to come to him.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: And Pimm and Swann.  Only Nix was ready for them.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Which goes first?  My face or your heart?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Who in God's name are you?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Find Valentin!  Find him!  Get him in here!

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: What are you doing?  This is sacrilege.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: It's all right.  It's not hurting...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: It looks like you're not a widow after all.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You rigged the illusion to fail, right?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You paid off the doctor.  You set up the fake body.  Yes?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And then... because I was getting too close to something --  --or someone, you called Swann

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I tried to pay you off.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: No.  It was mine.  I didn't want any more bloodshed. That's why we went to all this trouble, so there'd be no one for Nix to come after.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nix is dead and buried, for fuck's sake.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Haven't you seen enough to know that doesn't matter?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I want to see Swann face to face.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Why don't you leave this alone? Let everybody think it's over?

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Nix was never interested in you. It was always Swann.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Maybe Valentin's right.  We should let it alone.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He went to all that trouble to be dead.  Maybe we should let him stay that way.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: I've sometimes thought, if I'd had another profession, I would have been a surgeon.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: To be able to heal with one little cut.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Let's say those eyes of yours were giving you trouble.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: So tell me where Nix is buried.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I knew you wouldn't be able tn stay away.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You had to see who wept for you the most.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: A lot of people are going to be really pissed off when they discover you're still alive.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: You shouldn't have followed me, D'Amour.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: How the fuck do you do that?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Now I'm going to have to kill you.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I don't think so.  You need me alive.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Why?  So you can fuck my wife?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Be careful.  Funerals make me trigger-happy.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You know, it's such a fucking waste.  You can do shit most of us can only dream about, and you go around pretending it's some trick.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Illusionists get. Las Vegas contracts, D'Amour.  Magicians get burned.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Maybe he doesn't see it that way. Maybe he's digging his way out of the hole you put him right now.  That's what you're hiding away from, isn't it?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Now that I'm dead, the spotlight's off her.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: So Nix won't come looking for her?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And she shot him I  I think that'd piss me off if I were Nix.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: I don't know what else to do.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Listen.  If he's back from the dead, then he is some kind of god. And he'll find you, wherever the fuck you are. And if he's just another phony Messiah, then you can stage the greatest come-back in history.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Is this the best brandy you've got?

Speaker: cashier
Dialogue: If that's what's on the shelves.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Can you change a thousand for me?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Jesus.  Valentin.  What did you do to your face?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Guess who we're going to see?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: So I like playing games with people.  Gives them something to wonder about...

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: I distract them from their banality for a few minutes. It's like a public service.  It doesn't mean much in the end. They're all going to die.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Oh, I was going to discover the secret of the universe.  That's why I liked Nix.  He promised me all these explanations.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: He had something.  He showed me how to bend the rules.  A little levitation.  A few fireworks.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: No.  At the end... when we had him cornered, he got into my head. He showed me what we really look like, when the veneer's gone.  Jelly. Shit...

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: I saw it with my own fucking eyes! See, that's his best trick.  No illusions.  Just the truth.  Are you ready for that?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Did she know where Nix was buried?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Like the look of these?  I made them myself, to set him free.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Why did you wait so long?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: I didn't have the skill to resurrect him.  I had to teach myself.  And that took time.

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: And you think he'll be in a fit state to resurrect, after thirteen years?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: If he was just a man like me, then no.  But he's not.

Speaker: norman
Dialogue: He will come!  He will come! He will come!

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: If you've lied to me to me --

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I swear... this is the place Swann told me about.  The rocks...

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Five more minutes.  Hear me? And you'd better not --

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: What the fuck are you playing at?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Give me a hand.  I got Valentin.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: We've got to get you to a hospital.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Shut up.  We've lost enough lives already.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: ... Looks like you're going... to lose... one more.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: You don't get it, do you? We're shit. D'Amour.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: In my time, and nobody else's.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Do you wish him to be amongst us?

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Will you come to him on your knees?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Listen.  You've got everything you want.  You don't need me. ..

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: No, but he will.  After what you did to him.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: He'll want vengeance.  Simple PS that.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Oh my Lord.  He's coming home...

Speaker: cultists
Dialogue: He's coming home... he/s coming home...

Speaker: cultists
Dialogue: He's with us... He's with us...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Jesus... what the hell's going on in there?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: At a guess... they just resurrected him.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Will you suffer to come unto me?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I've come back to share the wisdom of the grave.  Will you hear it?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Oh yes... I do, don't I?  No gun this time, child?  Where's Swann?

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: I don't know where he is.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: He'll come.  We've got unfinished business, he and I.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Something terrible's going to happen.  But if you hold on to me, very tight, you may live a little longer.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Are you ready for my wisdom?

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: This is where we killed him.

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: I can't... I can't go any further...

Speaker: swann
Dialogue: Whatever he's doing to her, stop him!

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You see, I escaped the grave. So I have to give something to the grave in return.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I have to give something back. So I'm giving you.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You're not worthy.  None of you. Only Swann was worthy. You just waited like lambs.

Speaker: butterfield
Dialogue: Go on, bleed.  Go on!  Go on!

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You're not Swann.  Who are you?  Oh... I know what you want. He lets Dorothea slip from his arms.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I've had a lot of time to think about you.  Where I went wrong...

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I should have been honest with you, right from the start.  I wasn't born to show people the error of their ways.  I was born to murder the world.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You could still help me do that.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Because you've got nothing else to live for.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: The woman has a new love in her life.  Your friends are dead. Nobody's left to save you, but me

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Nix has got to have a weak spot. Everybody's got a fucking weak spot.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You know I'll kill you when we're done.  I have to.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: But until then... it's you and me... the way it always was.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Wait... you still feel something for that bitch?

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: She's just flesh, Swannnie-boy. I'll show you!

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: You've got Swann's disease. You think a little courage, a little love, and it'll all be all right. Wrong!

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Tell me where she is... and I'll make it go away...

Speaker: dorothea
Dialogue: Harry.  Listen to me. Whatever's good between us, believe it.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: Come on, child.  I want Swann to see you die.

Speaker: nix
Dialogue: I am the purest of the pure.  I am the darkest of the dark...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: He did something with the ground.
